summary: This document is an intelligence report detailing travel records and open-source information about Malcolm Grumbridge, a British solicitor with significant connections to the Maxwell family. It outlines his extensive travel history, his disbarment for professional misconduct, and his deep financial and business ties to Kevin and Ian Maxwell, positioning him as a key associate in their network.

persons.name: Malcolm Grumbridge
persons.context: A British solicitor who was removed from the legal profession in 2020 for misconduct. He has extensive business and financial ties to the Maxwell family, having established numerous companies linked to them and acted as a custodian for a London property.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: British socialite linked to Jeffrey Epstein. The document notes her connections and references Grumbridge as her legal advisor for the Hogarth Health Club.

persons.name: Kevin Maxwell
persons.context: Member of the Maxwell family with whom Malcolm Grumbridge set up several companies registered to The Hogarth Group.

persons.name: Ian Maxwell
persons.context: Member of the Maxwell family with whom Malcolm Grumbridge set up several companies registered to The Hogarth Group.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of the sex scandal linked to Ghislaine Maxwell and Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of the sex scandal linked to Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Grumbridge is cited as Ghislaine Maxwell's legal advisor for the Hogarth Health Club and is described as a Maxwell family friend and lawyer.
Grumbridge set up several companies registered to The Hogarth Group with Kevin Maxwell and was involved with two companies with him after a financial bailout.
Grumbridge set up several companies registered to The Hogarth Group with Ian Maxwell.
Linked together in the context of a sex scandal, as noted in open-source reporting.
Linked together in the context of a sex scandal, as noted in open-source reporting.

events.title: Malcolm Grumbridge Disbarment
events.description: Malcolm Grumbridge was found guilty of professional misconduct, quit the legal profession, and was removed from the Roll of Solicitors by the Solicitors Regulation Authority for failures related to money laundering, due diligence, and accounting rules.

events.title: Grumbridge's Last Known US Departure
events.description: Malcolm Grumbridge traveled outbound from JFK to London. This is noted as his last known US travel as of the report date.

events.title: Grumbridge's Extensive Travel
events.description: Between January 1, 2000, and December 14, 2021, Malcolm Grumbridge traveled 17 times, according to travel records.

keyFacts: Malcolm Grumbridge, a solicitor, was deeply embedded in the Maxwell family's financial affairs, having established around 150 companies in total and acted as custodian for a London property at 44 Kinnerton St.
Grumbridge was removed from the legal profession in 2020 for serious professional misconduct, including failures in anti-money laundering due diligence and lax accounting practices.
His last known travel from the United States was an outbound flight from JFK to London on October 27, 2019.
Open-source reporting links Grumbridge to Ghislaine Maxwell as her legal advisor for the Hogarth Health Club and describes him as a Maxwell family friend and lawyer.
Grumbridge's business ventures were specifically linked to Kevin and Ian Maxwell through several companies registered to The Hogarth Group.
